oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Phil Harris at Sulphur Dell ballpark and WSM, Nashville, Tennessee, 1951 July 27
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A scene from the day of events honoring entertainer Phil Harris (pictured center at the WSM microphone) in Nashville, Tennessee, July 27th, 1951. Harris was presented a “Phil Harris Day” proclamation by Mayor Ben West, and there was lots of entertainment including baseball and clowns. The main show featured singer Phil Harris and the band performing music on-stage--the show was broadcast live via WSM radio. Phil Harris (birth name: Wonga Philip Harris) was born in Indiana and grew up in Nashville, Tennessee. He led a distinguished career as a bandleader, singer, musician, actor, and comedian. Harris became a very well-known voice actor for animated films, such as Disney’s “The Jungle Book” and “Robin Hood” and “The AristoCats.” Harris has two stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
